c746740b-a075-4806-9a64-7719e9b6fb0c.description: The badge is issued to Elm employees who have successfully completed all phases of the Elm Innovation Pioneers Program. Program covers 5 topics which is Creative Confidence, Hello Design Thinking, Insights for Innovation, From Ideas to Action and the final project. In effort to support and promote innovation at Elm. Program Aims to: 1.Preparing innovation ambassadors n different company departments. 2.Solving the challenges that are facing clients. 3.Promoting innovation culture scientifically.
c746740b-a075-4806-9a64-7719e9b6fb0c.name: Innovation Pioneers Program

badge_template_activities.title: •Reading a book: The book tries to break the belief that creators are only a small group of people, and then offers a smart practical plan to enhance your creativity. also tries to provide some answers about how each of us can find his or her creative power, as well as ways of thinking that will change your personal and professional way of life.

•Training Courses:1.This flexible online experience offers for non-design thinking professionals’ practical concepts to know It also offers its specialists a proven and tested approach to solving creative problems, through case studies with IDEO experts and five quick activities. 2.In this course will develop "empathy" with customers to create the products and services they want and need. Also will acquire practical design skills and ways of thinking, helping transform customer needs into human

•Final Project: Includes a list of the challenges Elm faces. The participants are required to identify the problem through the empathize, questioning the target audience, collecting information in the process of empathize, analysis of the problem and summarized it as a story for the end-user.

ff47c5c2-c17d-4a33-89da-1f66d1f3745b.description: The badge is issued to Elm employees who have successfully completed all phases of Elm Innovation Pioneers Program - Advanced. The program covers 5 topics: Storytelling for Influence, Unlocking Creativity, Meats with expert, Designing a Business or Service Design (Optional courses) and a Final Project. Program Aims to: Preparing innovation ambassadors across the organization. Creatively solving the challenges that are facing clients. Promoting innovation culture.
ff47c5c2-c17d-4a33-89da-1f66d1f3745b.name: Innovation Pioneers Program – Advanced

badge_template_activities.title: Training Courses: 1. 1. Storytelling for Influence: Explore different ways of telling stories, how to receive feedback from others. 2. Unlocking Creativity: During this course, the participants will learn the tools which will help them learn how to overcome common barriers to innovation. And practical skills to help them learn the failure and success and the creative ideas that around them. 3. Designing a Business Or Service Design - Optional

Final Project: Learners choose a challenge that faces Elm, and starts from identifying the problem, gathering related data, generating the largest number of ideas, then create a prototype to test on users & do the improvements accordingly. - Learners present all the phases of the project to the projects committee.

30f37dcf-7ed2-45c2-964f-8c165e5651a5.description: The badge is issued to Elm employees who have successfully completed all phases of the product management program. The program covers topics related to Product Management, Strategically Understanding a Company, Design the Product, Product Marketing & Launch and Implementing systematic approach for product development & management.
30f37dcf-7ed2-45c2-964f-8c165e5651a5.name: Product Management program

badge_template_activities.title: • Module 1 (PMC): One-Week Technical Training including Introduction to Product Management, The Product Management Process and Core Values conducting Action Learning Session, Knowledge Sharing, and Project Presentation

• Module 2 (PLC): This program will be including a project and knowledge sharing 2 Modules (PMC)-(PLC): - Attend a minimum of 95% of the program training & knowledge sharing sessions. - Completing the program projects. - Presenting the program projects.

b2a54210-51b2-43d9-a779-619289467229.description: The badge is issued to Elm employees who have successfully completed all phases of the Women Leadership Development program. The program covers topics like Maximizing your Leadership Potential, Navigating Complex relationship & Individual Identity and three coaching sessions with experts in Leadership filed
b2a54210-51b2-43d9-a779-619289467229.name: Women Leadership Development Program

badge_template_activities.title: Completing Module 1: Maximizing your Leadership Potential (MLP) Guides participants in making the shift from successful individual contributor to effective manager - This program is designed to cultivate the four key roles that all leaders must play to garner success: team player, manager, coach, and leader. Meeting the needs of diverse teams & present new challenges that require new skills.

Completing Module 2: Navigating Complex relationship & Individual Identity - Individual identity work to identify personal triggers -Recognize and understand personal or own conflict “triggers”. -Understand how different values may contribute to complex situations and relationships at work. -Practice active and passive positive responses to the complex situations in the workplace. -Apply the strategies to an address workplace complexities and situation.

4c6a3635-e37d-44cf-a380-53609ba79de3.description: The badge is issued to Elm employees who have successfully completed all phases of the Elm Mobile Dev. Android Foundational Training. The program covers topics related to installing, configuring, and using Android studio IDE as well as running Android applications on both a device and on an emulator. Trainees will learn how to develop a simple Android application, how to satisfy specific system requirements, conforming to Android UI standards & guidelines as well as different design patterns.
4c6a3635-e37d-44cf-a380-53609ba79de3.name: Mobile Applications Developer – Android Foundational Level

badge_template_activities.title: • Training Path (Developing Android Applications): Instructor Led Online training. Study Material (soft copy) Lab access. Sessions delivered through Microsoft Teams assignments.
• Internal Training: Elm coding standards. Elm security standards. Elm code structure. Elm App architecture. Elm design pattern. Minimum Viable Product (MVP) assignment introduction

• Outcome Assessment Strategies: successful completion of the “Minimum Viable Product (MVP) Challenge”: by submitting a functional Android application developed according to shared specifications within the allotted timeframe and obtaining an assessment score above a certain threshold by the MVP Challenge committee.
